title: Credit Hour Limits for Regular Semesters

rules.description: Students may not exceed 9 credit hours unless they have fewer than 9 credit hours remaining to graduate.
Students with GPA >= 2.0 may register up to 18 credit hours.
Students with GPA between 1.0 and 2.0 may register up to 15 credit hours.
Students with GPA less than or equal 1.0 may register up to 12 credit hours.
Students with GPA greater than or equal 2.0 may register up to 21 credit hours if they are expected to graduate.

title: Credit Hour Limits for Summer Semester

rules.description: The maximum credit hours students can register in the summer semester is 6.
Students expected to graduate may register up to 9 credit hours in the summer.

rules.condition: If a student fails a course (score < 64)

action.grade_capping: Maximum grade counted is D+ after retaking
action.gpa_effect: Cumulative GPA is calculated based on the actual obtained grade, not capped grade
action.note: Student must retake the course after failing and cannot receive more than D+ even if they score higher

rules.condition: Newly admitted or has not passed 27 credit hours

title: Calculations of grades and GPA

Notes.InProgressCourses: Courses still in progress are marked as 'Con'.
Notes.NoGPAFor: Courses without credit hours are not included in GPA calculation.
Notes.PostCompletion: Courses taken after graduation are not counted toward the cumulative GPA.
Notes.GPAIncludes: Courses are included in GPA calculation whether passed or failed.

GPA Calculation Method.Step1: For each course, multiply the GPA value (based on the grade) by the number of credit hours.
GPA Calculation Method.Step2: Sum the results of all courses.
GPA Calculation Method.Step3: Divide the total grade points by the total number of registered credit hours.
GPA Calculation Method.Formula: GPA = Total Grade Points / Total Registered Credit Hours

Clssification: The general grade classification is determined based on the cumulative GPA
